com.pantech.fingerscan

Class FingerScanHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pantech.fingerscan.FingerScanHelper

  • public class FingerScanHelper
extends Object
    The main entry point for Fingerscan SDK. This class provides access to the fingerscan sdk. You should instantiate with try-catch to verify a device supports fingerscan sdk. After requestVerify(OnVerifyListener) is executed, onVerified() callback will be called and must call stopRequestVerify.
    Author:
    HoryunLee

      Constructor to initialize fingerscan sdk.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FingerScanHelper

        public FingerScanHelper(Context context)
                 throws IllegalAccessException,
                        SecurityException
        Constructor to initialize fingerscan sdk. You must use try-catch to verify that a device supports fingerscan sdk.
        Parameters:
        context - context of an application
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - if this device not support finger scan service
        SecurityException - if a permission(com.pantech.fingerprint.security) is not declared

    • Method Detail

      • requestVerify

        public void requestVerify(OnVerifyListener verifyListener)
                   throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Call this method to verify fingerprint result. All applications MUST call stopRequestVerify() method after this method is executed. Handler will call stop RequestVerify() method automatically if a user does not swipe fingerprint over the sensor for 30 secs.
        Parameters:
        verifyListener - the listener where the asynchronous onVerified() call are delivered.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - throw UnsupportedOperationException if fingerprint is not enrolled

      • requestVerify

        public void requestVerify(OnVerifyListener listener,
                 long delay)
                   throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Call this method to verify fingerprint result. All applications MUST call stopRequestVerify() method after this method is executed. Handler will call stop RequestVerify() method automatically after delay secs.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener where the asynchronous onVerified() call are delivered.
        delay - delay millisecond to stop service if no swiping fingerprint. default valus is 30 seconds.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - throw UnsupportedOperationException if fingerprint is not enrolled

      • setOnTimeoutListener

        public void setOnTimeoutListener(OnTimeoutListener listener)
        Register a callback to be invoked when timeout of requesting.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener where the asynchronous onTimeouted() call are delivered.

      • setDelayTime

        public void setDelayTime(long delay)
        Set the delay of timeout of request for verifying fingerprint.
        Parameters:
        delay - delay millisecond to stop service if no swiping fingerprint. default valus is 30 seconds.

      • stopRequestVerify

        public void stopRequestVerify()
        Stop requestVerify() manually. All application MUST call this method after verification
